section.title: Core properties
section.p: The following table displays examples of business types properties.

stentry.p: The business type name; a camel-cased identifier.
For more information about naming conventions for entities, see section Naming conventions.

strow.stentry: Primitive type on which the business type is based. For a list of provided primitive types, see section .

This represents the maximum number of characters that the application supports for this business type. This constraint can, for instance, correspond to the Database physical constraint of the table field. This constraint applies on base type String only. This property is for information purposes only and is not used by the Page Designer.

This pattern is a regular expression that expresses the character business type limitations that the application requires. This constraint applies on base type String only. This property is for information purposes only and is not used by the Page Designer.

This represents the number of total digits supported by the application for attributes based on this business type. This constraint only applies if the base type is a real number. This property is retrieved by the Page Designer. For instance, an attribute of type Amount with Total Digits = 16 that is dropped in a grid creates a Text field widget with the Total Digits = 16 (BT).

This represents the number of fractional digits supported by the application for attributes based on this business type. This constraint only applies if the base type is a real number. This property is retrieved by the Page Designer. For instance, an attribute of type Amount with Fractional Digits = 2 that is dropped in a grid creates a Text field widget with the Fractional Digits = 2 (BT).

stentry.p: This represents the corresponding Database type used by the application.
stentry.note: This property is for information purposes only and is not used by the Page Designer.

stentry.p:
This corresponds to the type of
Triple'A Plus Core application. This property derives from the TripleA annotation.
stentry.note: This property is for information purposes only and is not used by the Page Designer.

stentry.p: The widget name corresponds to one of the editable and modifiable widgets that the Page Designer provides. This property derives from the Widget annotation.
stentry.note: This property is retrieved by the Page Designer. When an attribute based on this business type is dropped in a page model's grid, the Page Designer associates the selected widget to the attribute label.

stentry.p: This table of property names and values corresponds to the widget properties you want to set by default. This property derives from the Widget annotation.
stentry.note: This property is retrieved by the Page Designer. When an attribute based on this business type is dropped in a page model's grid, the Page Designer sets the values of the business types to the given widget properties.
stentry.p:
Some exceptions exist in Triple'A Plus for entity attributes based on code and name business types. Annotations are created on entity attributes during meta-dictionary importation. When the attribute is dropped in the page model, the TripleA annotation properties AttrMaxDbLength, AttrDefaultDisplayLength , if exists, are respectively set to the TextField widget properties Maximum characters and width,
overriding the business type properties.
